items.title: Sultana accuses Corbyn of 'baseless' character attacks
items.excerpt: Former Labour MP Zarah Sultana has accused Jeremy Corbyn and other members of a new left-wing party of "baseless attacks" on her character and said she is consulting lawyers.

items.title: South Carolina lawmakers haven't been paid after one of their own sued over raise
items.excerpt: South Carolina legislators are not getting paid for the rest of the year over a lawsuit about a recent pay raise

items.title: Opponents prosper with divided unionism, says DUP leader
items.excerpt: The leader of the Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) has told his annual conference "when unionism is divided, our opponents prosper".

items.title: Lib Dems want to use wartime powers to clear asylum backlog
items.excerpt: The government should use emergency wartime powers to clear the asylum backlog and reduce the use of hotels, the Liberal Democrats have said.

items.title: Lib Dems reject debate on blocking trans women from diversity quotas
items.excerpt: A bid to remove trans women from Liberal Democrat diversity quotas has been blocked by party members at their annual conference.

items.title: Commons open to espionage after China spying charges dropped, says Speaker
items.excerpt: The Speaker of the Commons has said the decision to drop charges against two men accused of spying for China could leave Parliament vulnerable to espionage.

items.title: Under pressure to police comments on Kirk, colleges walk a tightrope on free speech
items.excerpt: Colleges around the country are under intense pressure to police insensitive comments about the assassination of Charlie Kirk, which leaves them with no easy choices

items.title: Trump says he didn't want London Mayor Sadiq Khan at state banquet
items.excerpt: US President Donald Trump has said he "didn't want" London Mayor Sir Sadiq Khan at the state banquet hosted by the King at Windsor Castle.

items.title: SNP  minister Jamie Hepburn resigns after assault claim
items.excerpt: Scottish government minister Jamie Hepburn has resigned after he was accused of physically assaulting the Conservative MSP Douglas Ross.

items.title: Scotland becoming less tolerant to immigration - Humza Yousaf
items.excerpt: Scotland is becoming less tolerant towards immigration, its former first minister claims.

items.title: Reform councillor suspended for alleged PM threats
items.excerpt: A Reform UK councillor has been suspended from the party following allegations he made online comments threatening to kill the prime minister.

items.title: Political parties trade blame for potential shutdown
items.excerpt: Republicans and Democratic lawmakers show no signs of budging as the House takes up a bill to avert a partial government shutdown in less than two weeks

items.title: Phillipson suggests two-child benefit cap could be lifted
items.excerpt: Bridget Phillipson has said scrapping the two-child benefit cap is "on the table", in the clearest sign yet that ministers could scrap the policy.

items.title: More than 400 arrests made in Chicago area operation so far, top immigration official says
items.excerpt: Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials have arrested over 400 people in the Chicago area as part of an operation that began less than two weeks ago

items.title: Mixed reaction to UK-Ireland Troubles legacy deal
items.excerpt: Victims' families, campaigners and politicians have given a mixed response to a new framework aimed at addressing Northern Ireland Troubles legacy cases.

items.title: Minister rejects Trump's call for military to tackle illegal migration
items.excerpt: The UK military is focused on defending the nation rather than stopping asylum seekers from crossing the Channel, a cabinet minister has said.

items.title: Migrant returned to France after government wins court challenge
items.excerpt: An Eritrean man has left the UK under the government's "one in, one out" deal with France, after a last-minute court bid to delay the departure failed.

items.title: Mayor loses no confidence vote in airport row
items.excerpt: A Labour mayor has lost a symbolic "no confidence" vote put forward by a Reform UK councillor.

items.title: Five new unitary authorities would 'save £52m a year'
items.excerpt: Creating five new unitary authorities for Sussex would save £52.4m a year, Brighton & Hove City Council (BHCC) leaders have said.

items.title: First students evacuated from Gaza to study in UK
items.excerpt: A group of 34 students in Gaza with places at British universities have been evacuated and are due to arrive in the UK within days.

items.title: Faisal Islam: Will the US tech bromance turn around the UK economy?
items.excerpt: In the old Camden Town Hall opposite London's St Pancras station, away from the white tie and tails of the pageantry at Windsor Castle, was perhaps the most substantive display of the consequences of US President Donald Trump's state visit.

items.title: Elected officials among dozens of protesters arrested at a Manhattan immigration holding facility
items.excerpt: More than a dozen elected officials have been arrested while protesting conditions at a New York City immigration holding facility where a federal judge extended a court order requiring the government to shape up its treatment of detainees

items.title: Despite another loss, Dolphins showed fight against the Bills, which could help avoid further spiral
items.excerpt: Dolphins receiver Jaylen Waddle opened the celebrations by hauling in a touchdown pass from Tua Tagovailoa and breaking out his signature penguin waddle

items.title: Corbyn allies disappointed at row with Sultana over new party
items.excerpt: Allies of Jeremy Corbyn have said they are "disappointed" at the deep divisions which have emerged between Zarah Sultana and the former Labour leader over the formation of a new party.

items.title: Bills running back James Cook is already validating his new contract 3 weeks into the season
items.excerpt: Buffalo Bills running back James Cook might be due for another raise

items.title: Assisted dying bill moves one step closer to becoming law
items.excerpt: The assisted dying bill has passed its second reading in the House of Lords, moving it another step closer to becoming law.

items.title: White House scraps water expert's nomination as states hash out Colorado River plan
items.excerpt: A veteran water expert from Arizona says his nomination has been pulled to lead the federal agency overseeing water management in the western U.S. Ted Cooke tells The Associated Press that he was preparing for a confirmation hearing but his name was re...

items.title: South Carolina fires election chief as state deals with Trump administration request for voter data
items.excerpt: South Carolina has fired its election director amid negotiations with the Trump administration over voter data

items.title: Senate confirms 48 of Trump's nominees at once after changing the chamber's rules
items.excerpt: The Senate has confirmed 48 of President Donald Trump’s nominees

items.title: Rudy Giuliani is ordered to pay $1.36 million in legal bills
items.excerpt: It’s another blow to Rudy Giuliani’s withered wallet: A judge has ordered the former New York City mayor to pay $1.36 million in legal fees he racked up during investigations into his efforts to overturn President Donald Trump’s 2020 election loss

items.title: House turns back effort to censure Rep. Ilhan Omar over remarks about Charlie Kirk
items.excerpt: The House declined late Wednesday to punish one of its own over commentary in the aftermath of Charlie Kirk’s assassination

items.title: Harris says Buttigieg was her 'first choice' for 2024 running mate but the pairing was too risky
items.excerpt: In an excerpt of former Vice President Kamala Harris's new book, she says she would have picked Pete Buttigieg as her running mate last year but America wasn’t ready for the pairing

items.title: Experts independently resurrect Census Bureau advisory committee axed by Trump administration
items.excerpt: A U.S. Census Bureau advisory committee disbanded by the Trump administration has reconstituted itself

items.title: Corbyn and Sultana clash over new party membership
items.excerpt: Ex-Labour MP Zarah Sultana has accused Jeremy Corbyn of overseeing a "sexist boys' club" locking women out of the founding of a new left-wing party the pair announced earlier this year.

items.title: Charlie Kirk's Turning Point taps his widow as its next leader. Questions about its future remain
items.excerpt: Turning Point USA, the organization Charlie Kirk founded to mobilize young conservatives, has seen a massive surge in interest and support since the activist’s assassination last week

items.title: Trump's call to end mail-in voting creates a dilemma for GOP
items.excerpt: President Donald Trump has vowed to do away with voting by mail, but some of his Republican allies in battleground Arizona are taking a more cautious approach

items.title: Suspect left note saying he planned to kill Charlie Kirk, later confessed in texts, prosecutor says
items.excerpt: The man accused of assassinating conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a Utah university has been charged with aggravated murder

items.title: From Utah to New York, key developments in cases of US political violence
items.excerpt: Political violence has rocked the U.S. multiple times in recent months, culminating with the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk at a Utah university

items.title: Rookie errors and coaching regrets shape outcomes for Colts, Broncos, Seahawks, Steelers
items.excerpt: Steelers rookie returner Kaleb Johnson made a costly mistake in Week 2 of the NFL season

items.title: Bengals coach Zac Taylor has trust in backup QB Jake Browning as team begins tough stretch
items.excerpt: Zac Taylor will have to get through an extended period without franchise quarterback Joe Burrow for the third time in his tenure as the Cincinnati Bengals’ coach
